translation: przyjęcie [the act of accepting someone into an institution, organization, etc.; the right to enter a place or to join an institution]
sentence: She's applied for admission to law school.
The barn of the other side of the farmyard is full of hay bales.

translation: rozpacz (lub: sytuacja niebezpieczna) [a feeling of extreme worry, sadness, or pain]
sentence: Many of the horses were showing signs of distress at the end of the race.
Three minutes into the game, Jackson limped off the pitch with a serious ankle injury.

translation: sprzeczka, kłótnia [an angry disagreement between two or more people or groups]
sentence: They had a bitter quarrel about/over some money three years ago and they haven't spoken to each other since.

translation: pozbywać się [to free a person or place of something unwanted or harmful]
sentence: In the city, it is hard to rid a building permanently of pests.

translation: nabierać [to remove something from a container using a spoon, your curved hands, etc]
sentence: She scooped the ice cream into the dishes.
She got some eggs out and heated a pan on the stove.

translation: ty [you, used when speaking to one person; old use]

sentence: People throughout the country are out of work.

translation: zawór [a device that opens and closes to control the flow of liquids or gases, or a similar structure in the heart and the veins that controls the flow of blood]
sentence: It was a weak heart valve that caused her death.

translation: cud, dziwo [an object that causes a feeling of great surprise and admiration]
sentence: We spent a week visiting the wonders of Ancient Greek civilization.
